title: Centrica Business Solutions to optimise Eelpower’s 10MW battery
lead: ​Centrica Business Solutions is to optimise Eelpower’s 10MW Leverton storage project.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Smart meter installations hold steady despite lockdown
lead: Energy companies' smart meter installations have "rebounded" since the UK's first coronavirus lockdown despite restrictions waxing and waning across the country, new figures show.
author: Edith Hancock

title: Shell backs GreenCom’s €12 million equity funding bid for global expansion
lead: O&G giant Shell has backed residential renewables platform GreenCom Network’s €12 million (£11 million) funding round through its investment arm, Shell Ventures.
author: Edith Hancock

title: BP brings Chargemaster and Polar together under new BP Pulse umbrella
lead: ​BP has launched BP Pulse, the new name for both BP Chargemaster and the Polar network.
author: Alice Grundy

title: National Grid ESO issues CM notice as low generation eats into its safety buffer
lead: ​National Grid ESO has issued a Capacity Market (CM) notice for this afternoon, with the margin set to fall below the set threshold.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Instavolt to rollout 450 chargers in new KFC partnership
lead: ​Instavolt has signed a second partnership with a UK fast food retailer, unveiling plans to install chargers at KFC UK & Ireland’s sites.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Yorkshire Energy becomes latest supplier to close as market remains challenging for small players
lead: ​Yorkshire Energy has ceased to trade, becoming the latest small supplier casualty of 2020.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: CMA launches EV charging sector study to tackle range anxiety and promote competition
lead: ​The Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) has launched a study into to the electric vehicle (EV) charging sector to ensure the fast-growing area works for UK drivers.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: CCC: UK should aim for 68% carbon emissions reduction for 2030 NDC
lead: ​A UK reduction in territorial emissions of at least 68% as part of its nationally determined contribution (NDC) has been recommended by the Committee on Climate Change (CCC).
author: Alice Grundy

title: ‘Decarbonisation starts at home’: Northern Powergrid on delivering a net zero network
lead: Northern Powergrid's Jim Cardwell takes a look at how DNO's can work to decarbonise in light of Boris Johnson's Ten Point Plan.
author: Jim Cardwell

title: DriveElectric partners with ReFLEX Orkney to encourage early EV adoption on the green island
lead: ​DriveElectric has teamed up with the ReFLEX Orkney project, to support electric vehicles (EVs) to further develop flexibility on the island.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Reaching net zero to cost £3 trillion, says National Grid ESO
lead: ​Reaching net zero in the energy network will cost the UK £3 trillion, according to a new cost analysis from National Grid ESO.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: BEIS consults on inclusion of EV in the Capacity Market to build supply security
lead: ​The Department of Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy (BEIS) is consulting in the inclusion of electric vehicles (EVs) in the Capacity Market (CM).
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Current± Predicts: How our 2020 predictions fared
lead: We take a look at how accurate our energy experts predictions for 2020 have proven.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Northern Powergrid launches ‘no one size fits all’ 19MW flexibility tender
lead: Distribution network operator (DNO) Northern Powergrid calls for up to 19MW of flexibility to manage growth from low carbon energy providers.
author: Edith Hancock

title: Energy White Paper to be published by the end of 2020 says BEIS as it misses autumn deadline
lead: ​The UK Government has again failed to publish the Energy White Paper, pushing back the deadline again.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Energy majors call for net zero power system ambition as part of 'Sprint to Glasgow'
lead: ​Energy majors have called on the UK government to target a net zero power system as part of the 'Sprint to Glasgow' lead-up to the COP26 climate conference.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: SPEN partners Warmworks Scotland to roll-out Tesla batteries in social housing
lead: ​ScottishPower Energy Networks (SPEN) has installed more than 100 homes with battery storage as part of the Warmworks Scotland project.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Ofgem awards £58m to highly ambitious flexibility and hydrogen projects
lead: ​Ofgem has awarded up to £58 million to five projects designed to support the UK’s transition to net zero.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Utilita Energy condemns ‘grossly unfair’ Ofgem smart meter warning
lead: ​Utilita Energy has criticised Ofgem’s suggestion that it would take emergency measures if it fails to meet second generation smart meter targets, claiming it is ‘grossly unfair’.
author: Molly Lempriere
